title: Debutant faces veterans in Ponnurunni East poll battle
content: LDF candidate Beena Divakaran, though a newcomer, is confident of the dominance of the front in the division where it has not tasted defeat in over four decades; three-time councillor Sunitha Dixon, BJP candidate, and UDF’s Jain Gray are her opponents

title: Manipur’s banned outfits warned against disrupting peace
content: A coalition of five armed groups threatened people who attended the recently concluded Sangai Festival with punitive action

title: Ernakulam reports highest number of influenza infections in Kerala
content: A total of 340 cases and two deaths, one each in Thiruvananthapuram and Malappuram, were reported in November

title: Path paved to link India’s skill base with Russia’s demand for labourers
content: Moscow is reported to need 5,00,000 semi-skilled workers; a formal agreement aims to facilitate safe mobility

title: GHMC reviews air quality measures in city NCAP meeting
content: Key measures include expanding TGSRTC electric bus fleet on high-pollution routes, promoting electric three-wheelers, tightening pollution-under-control compliance for older vehicles, improving pedestrian infrastructure

title: India-Russia friendship remains steady like the pole star, says PM
content: The Russian President is on a two-day visit; PM signals that energy ties will continue as a “strong and vital pillar” of the partnership, despite Western opposition; 16 MoUs signed; PM announces free e-tourist visas for Russians

title: Adani coal mine: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs protest felling of nearly 6 lakh trees in Singrauli
content: Minister of State for Forest Dilip Ahirwar says trees are being cut as per rules of the Centre and State, and that the same number of trees are being planted at different locations

title: As NC marks 120th birth anniversary of Sheikh Abdullah, no statement from J&K  Lieutenant Governor
content: Sheikh Abdullah founded the National Conference and was a former CM of J&K; L-G’s office usually issues statements on anniversaries of major public figures; scrapped move to declare holiday on anniversary

title: France’s Knight of the Order of Arts and Letters award to Ravi Deecee
content: The Ambassador of France to India confers the insignia of the award on the publisher and managing director of DC Books

title: DMK, BJP members face off in Lok Sabha over Karthigai Deepam ritual at  Thirupparankundram temple
content: DMK leader T.R. Baalu accuses the BJP of trying to “ignite communal tensions” in Tamil Nadu, while Union Minister of State for Parliamentary Affairs L.  Murugan  alleges that the State government is denying devotees their right to worship

title: High cost of infertility treatments puts financial strain on couples: ICMR-NIRRCH study
content: Stating that median out-of-pocket expenditure for infertility treatment was ₹11,317, the study said direct medical costs for medicines and investigations were high in private facilities while the non-medical and indirect costs were higher among those seeking infertility services from public facilities.

title: Women Safety Wing signs two MoUs to expand youth-led safety initiatives
content: Two partnerships aimed at strengthening community safety, youth leadership and gender-sensitisation programmes across the State

title: Calls grow for platform screen doors in metro stations, but rollout on existing routes faces cost and engineering setbacks
content: In February 2024, BMRCL installed metal railings along parts of the interchange platforms to limit track access. The corporation has since been studying the effectiveness of these installations, especially at high-traffic stations

title: Madras High Court restrains release of Nandamuri Balakrishna starrer Akhanda 2
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan grant the interim injunction following a monetary dispute between the production firm 14 Reels Plus LLP and Eros International

title: Kharge, Rahul not invited to Putin banquet: Congress
content: Shashi Tharoor makes it to the guest list as chairman of the Parliamentary Committee on External Affairs

title: Centenarian doctor donates ₹3.4 crore to AIIMS Bhubaneswar for cancer research
content: Professor K. Laxmi Bai’s contribution will create a corpus fund to support gynaecological oncology research and preventive care

title: Ruling regime trying to distort Nehru’s legacy: Sonia Gandhi
content: Speaking at the launch of the Nehru Centre India, the Congress leader says a ‘systematic effort’ was underway to distort Nehru’s ideas and undermine his contribution to the freedom movement and the shaping of modern India

title: Russia ships fuel for Kudankulam’s third reactor
content: The shipments of fuel are provided under the contract signed in 2024, which includes fuel supply for units 3 and 4 of the KKNPP for the entire service life starting from the initial loading

title: Weight loss drugs have great action, but can’t replace diet and exercise: Diabetes Federation president
content: “The new GLP-1 class of drugs comprises brilliant molecules that have very good action, but they are also very expensive”

title: New Bill will give employee right to ‘disconnect’ calls from work
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore introduced a bill to exempt Tamil Nadu from the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for admission to undergraduate medical courses

title: Indian Railways adds extra coaches to meet rush of weary passengers
content: After IndiGo flight cancellations, many passengers head to railway stations to catch trains to their destinations

title: Row in Lok Sabha after Trinamool MP objects to deportation of Bangla-speaking people
content: Shatabdi Roy’s remarks on language-based deportation spark protests as BJP MPs deny the charge and demand withdrawal of her comments

title: BJP alleges corruption in Corporation, CPI(M) leaders to take legal action
content: BJP alleges graft in selection of service provider for biocompost kitchen bin project and in tendering of civil works. V.K. Prasanth says a Vigilance inquiry has rejected all the allegations and roadwork rates are fixed as per CPWD rates

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to levya special cess on pan masala
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman says the cess will be shared with the States; it will be levied on the production capacity of machines in pan masala manufacturing factories; main aim to meet expenditure on national security and health

title: Sunali returns to India six months after being pushed back into Bangladesh
content: On December 3, the Union government had agreed to bring Sunali Khatun and her minor son back from Bangladesh on ‘humanitarian grounds’ after the Supreme Court’s intervention.

title: 7-year-old girl dies of severe dengue shock syndrome in Bengaluru
content: The child’s parents, migrant workers, moved to the city two months ago and were living in shanty in Varthur

title: Minister unveils ₹97.40 lakh facilities at Nuzvid schools
content: Kolusu highlights youth role in nation-building, announces Student-Friendly Kits and notes recruitment of 16,347 teachers during Mega Parents-Teachers 3.0 programme

title: Party chiefs outline development, welfare projects for Kozhikode
content: A pre-poll discussion organised by the Calicut Press Club saw three district chiefs of mainstream political parties outlining their visions, priorities, expectations, and manifesto commitments ahead of the three-tier local body elections 2025

title: Rahul Mamkootathil’s staff member, driver named accused
content: Fazal and Alwin allegedly helped the legislator, who has been accused in a sexual abuse case, go absconding

title: Deadline approaches for Telangana’s Waqf Portal registrations amid uncertainties
content: Over 40,000 waqf institutions registered on the UMEED portal as of Friday; Telangana State Waqf Board ready to approach Waqf Tribunal to seek extension of deadline

title: Railway tracks blocked in Punjab as farmers push back against Electricity Amendment Bill, 2025
content: Farmers under the banner Kisan Mazdoor Morcha staged a ‘symbolic rail roko’ agitation and accused the Centre of ignoring their grievances. They also threatened to elevate the issue by removing the smart meters on December 10 if the demands remain unmet

title: Rajasthan begins Ferozepur Feeder reconstruction to strengthen canal irrigation network
content: Bhajan Lal Sharma launches ₹1,717-crore works to enhance irrigation in northern Rajasthan and improve water supply through the Gang Canal system

title: As IndiGo crisis continues, airlines take advantage charging high fare
content: The airfares to Kerala from various cities, including Delhi and Mumbai, are jacked up tenfold, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded in various cities

title: India, Russia agree on Arctic and nuclear cooperation
content: With polar ice melting, new sea routes may open in the Arctic; India, Russia welcome progress made in cooperation on the Northern Sea Route; India will “strive to” allot a site for a second nuclear plant after Kudankulam

title: Pawan Kalyan urges teachers to nurture achievers, not ‘manufacture employees’
content: Deputy Chief Minister stresses coordination among students, parents, and teachers; promises books, playground plan and warns against politicisation and substance abuse

title: YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy cries foul over CID, ACB probe into Parakamani theft case
content: The investigation has not been done as directed by the court, the former TTD chairman alleges, and vows to quit politics if his alleged links with the main accused is proven

title: Telangana Rising 2047 Vision document getting final touches
content: Encompassing sector-specific plans to pave the way towards $3 trillion economy goal of Telangana; the document, in English, Telugu and Urdu, will be presented to 1,000 delegates

title: A.P. liquor scam: remand of nine accused extended till Dec. 19
content: Producing a key accused, Anil Chokhara, in the court, SIT sleuths claimed that he was instrumental in diverting the liquor scam proceeds through 35 shell companies

title: How Vizag woman’s death brought to light biggest organ-trafficking network in Andhra Pradesh
content: The 29-year-old woman left home saying she was going on a trip with friends, but it turned out to be her tragic end. The death of the woman from a below poverty line family exposed how vulnerable individuals and families fall prey to illegal organ sale networks. K. Umashanker and Harish Gilai delve deep into the racket allegedly operating from Global Multi-Specialty Hospital in Madanapalle

title: TDP leader condemns Jagan’s comments on ghee adulteration and Parakamani theft cases
content: How can the cases appear to be inconsequential for the YSRCP president, questions TDP official spokesman Vijay Kumar

title: Congress slams Modi government as IndiGo cancellations spark nationwide disruption
content: Rahul Gandhi links IndiGo crisis to the Centre’s monopoly model while the Congress accuses the government of weakening competition in India’s aviation sector

title: Kerala Governor, Chief Minister lock horns over selection of Vice-Chancellors
content: Pinarayi accuses Arlekar of violating SC directive regarding the appointment of Vice-Chancellors to KTU and digital university by picking a candidate the CM had found ineligible. Lok Bhavan says SC had clearly said that the Chancellor was free to have his reservations about the candidates recommended by the CM

title: Campaign against ‘privatisation’ of medical colleges receives overwhelming response, says YSRCP leader Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy
content: Over one crore signatures have been collected in one week and the numbers are growing rapidly, he claims, adding the people’s movement has transformed into a massive pubic uprising

title: USMNT draws Paraguay, Australia at '26 World Cup
content: The United States will face Paraguay, Australia and the winner of a UEFA playoff featuring Türkiye, Romania, Slovakia and Kosovo in the group stage of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Men's World Cup draw: Recapping events in Washington, D.C.
content: After all the talk, teams finally learned their opponents; Mexico and South Korea open the tournament on June 11.

title: Someone had to 'challenge NASCAR,' says Jordan
content: Retired NBA great Michael Jordan testified Friday at the NASCAR antitrust trial that "someone had to step forward and challenge the entity" over its current business model.

title: Georgia seeks $390K from DE Wilson over transfer
content: Georgia's athletic department is headed to court to try to obtain $390,000 in damages from a former standout defensive end who transferred from the school after his sophomore season in a potentially precedent-setting case.

title: Henry Jr., No. 7 recruit for '26, picks Ohio State
content: Five-star wide receiver Chris Henry Jr., the No. 7 overall recruit in the SC NEXT 300 for 2026, affirmed his commitment to Ohio State and will sign with the Buckeyes.

title: Bears without WR Odunze vs. Packers on Sunday
content: Top wide receiver Rome Odunze will not play with the Bears this weekend versus the Packers due to a foot injury, the team announced Friday.

title: Coach: 'Unfortunate' CB Slay not joining Bills
content: Veteran cornerback Darius Slay has yet to report to Buffalo as the Bills navigate roster fallout after the waiver mix-up.

title: Source: Lions DB Branch suffered torn Achilles
content: Lions star defensive back Brian Branch tore his Achilles during the team's Thursday night game versus the Cowboys, a source told ESPN.

title: E. Campbell died of drowning after medical issue
content: Former basketball player Elden Campbell died Monday from drowning after suffering a medical emergency while out fishing, his sister and a Broward County official confirmed.

title: ↔️ Olney and Passan: MLB free agency intel
content: Here's our latest intel heading into the MLB winter meetings, starting with the slugger who holds the key to the offseason.

title: CFP chaos scenarios for every league and what to watch in nine conference titles
content: Bill Connelly looks at key angles for all nine games -- and why the playoff committee could get a headache.

title: Our guide to every Week 14 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Shedeur Sanders vs. Cam Ward? Joe Burrow vs. Josh Allen? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 14 game.

title: Barnwell's end of the year prove-it list: 17 coaches and players with something at stake
content: Kenneth Walker III is among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

title: 10 NFL veterans who could unexpectedly be on the move this offseason: Surprise cut, trade candidates
content: Would the Eagles trade A.J. Brown in the offseason? Could the Ravens face salary cap decisions on two stars? Is Kyler Murray's time in Arizona running out?

title: The old, struggling Clippers have options -- none of them good
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst surveyed the league on LA's next steps. Three difficult paths emerged.

title: This East lead hasn't come easy for the Pistons' young core
content: With every win, Detroit and its young core are moving further away from the dregs of a grueling rebuild.

title: Myles Garrett's journey to the NFL sack record: 'It is written'
content: Four sacks shy of making NFL history, the Cleveland Browns veteran is among the all-time great pass rushers.

title: Why are so many NHL games going to overtime? Five theories from players, coaches, execs
content: Through 425 games, 27.3% have gone past regulation. If that holds, it would be the highest rate since 2005-06.

title: Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's most intriguing December game
content: The Capitals, Penguins and Flyers are the big risers this week, with the Ducks, Devils and Mammoth sliding.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: MLS Cup in Miami is all about Messi. Can Müller, Vancouver crash the party?
content: It's fitting that MLS Cup takes place on the same weekend as Miami's art fair, as old masters Lionel Messi and Thomas Müller prepare to face off.

title: Why team-provided housing has become a flashpoint
content: As both sides continue negotiations ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline, housing emerged as an issue in the latest proposal.

title: The 30 best MMA fighters under 30 in 2025
content: From top stars Ilia Topuria and Dakota Ditcheva to rising contenders Joshua Van and Natalia Silva, ESPN ranks the top 30 fighters under age 30.

title: Power Rankings: Michigan leaps to No. 1, plus 5 new faces
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 14: Trevor Lawrence and other QB replacements
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Jaguars' passing game and Titans defense.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Jaylon Tyson, trade away LeBron James, LaMelo Ball
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Can Real Betis halt Barcelona run?
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar as Julien Laurens picks out the best games ahead in Europe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man United eye Mouzakitis
content: Real Madrid could rival Manchester United to sign Olympiacos wonderkid Christos Mouzakitis. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 title contenders: How they got here and who's bound for glory in Abu Dhabi
content: For the first time since 2010, more than two drivers have a shot at the title in the season finale, so how did the championship protagonists get here?

title: With Direct Connectivity To Airport, Navi Mumbai Gets New Train Station
content: Ahead of operations beginning at the Navi Mumbai International Airport on December 25, the airport will also get a railway station nearby, as the Targhar station on the Uran-Belapur line is also operationalised.

title: US Supreme Court Agrees To Hear Trump Birthright Citizenship Order Case
content: The Supreme Court agreed on Friday to take up the constitutionality of President Donald Trump's order on birthright citizenship declaring that children born to parents who are in the United States illegally or temporarily are not American citizens.

title: Amid Tamil Nadu Temple Lamp Row, MK Stalin's Development Swipe At Centre
content: As the BJP intensified its attack on the ruling DMK over what it calls an "anti-Hindu stand" in the Thirupparankundram lamp lighting controversy, Chief Minister MK Stalin has attempted to turn the spotlight back on the Centre.

title: Vladimir Putin In India Highlights: PM Modi, Putin Sit Together At State Banquet, President Murmu Delivers Speech
content: Putin India Visit Highlights: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: Nirav Modi Cites "Lack Of Legal Papers", Seeks Adjournment Of Trial In UK
content: Nirav Modi, wanted in India to face fraud and money laundering charges, is forced to share a small prison cell with a shared desk with other inmates without access to most of his legal paperwork, the High Court in London was told on Friday.

title: Cheetah Cub Dies In Kuno National Park A Day After Being Released Into Wild
content: One of the two cheetah cubs released into the wild at the Kuno National Park the day before was found dead on Friday, a forest official said.

title: "No Means No": Shashi Tharoor Introduces Bill Criminalising Marital Rape
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor introduced a private member's bill in the Lok Sabha on Friday to criminalise marital rape and asserted that India must uphold its constitutional values and move from "no means no" to "only yes means yes".

title: Delhi Police Issues Notice To D K Shivakumar In National Herald Case
content: The Delhi Police has issued a notice to Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar seeking financial and transactional details as part of its probe into the National Herald case, an official said on Friday.

title: Saudi Clerics Expected, Biryani For 40,000 At Trinamool MLA's Mosque Event
content: The venue for suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir's foundation-stone ceremony for a 'Babri Masjid-style' mosque in West Bengal's Murshidabad on December 6 turned into a massive worksite on Friday, with Saudi clerics expected, food was being prepared.

title: Amid US Pressure, Putin Offers India "Uninterrupted Shipments Of Fuel"
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Friday he was ready to continue "uninterrupted shipments" of fuel to India, as New Delhi faces heavy US pressure to stop buying oil from Moscow.

title: "Visit To Remember": S Jaishankar Sees Off Putin After 2-Day India Trip
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday departed for Russia from Palam Technical Airport after concluding his India visit.

title: Stepfather Tries To Kill Children By Throwing Them In Noida Drain, Arrested: Cops
content: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly throwing his two stepchildren into a 10-foot-deep drain in Noida with the intention to kill them, police said on Friday.

title: Supporters Block Roads After Police Arrest Chhattisgarh Kranti Sena Chief
content: Amit Baghel, the state president of the Chhattisgarh Kranti Sena, was arrested by Devendra Nagar police on Thursday while attempting to surrender in a case involving alleged objectionable remarks.

title: Indians Among Delivery Riders To Be Deported For Illegally Working In UK
content: Indians are among 171 delivery riders caught working illegally in a UK-wide crackdown and have been detained for deportation from the country, the British government has said.

title: Andhra Man Missing After He Moved To Mali For Work, Claims Family
content: A 26-year-old man from Talapula Mandal in Sri Satya Sai district has gone missing in an African country, his family claimed on Thursday.

title: Ex-Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia's Travel To London For Treatment Postponed
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia is unlikely to travel to London before Sunday for advanced treatment following delay in her scheduled medical flight.

title: Lok Sabha Bill Seeks Employees' Right To Disconnect Calls Beyond Work Hours
content: A private member's bill, which seeks to allow employees not to entertain work-related calls and emails outside work hours, was introduced in Lok Sabha on Friday.

title: US Positions India As Important Partner In New National Security Strategy
content: The Trump Administration has positioned India as a critical partner in its newly released National Security Strategy, signalling Washington's intent to deepen cooperation with New Delhi across economic, technological and defence sectors.

title: Cop Burnt Alive After Car Rams Divider, Bursts Into Flames In Karnataka
content: A police inspector was burnt alive after his car hit a divider and went up in flames on the outskirts of Annigeri town in Karnataka's Dharwad district

title: Real-Time Updates And More: How Mumbai Airport Is Dealing With IndiGo Crisis
content: While IndiGo staff at airports are simply overwhelmed and are grappling with thousands of angry travellers, airports have made arrangements to provide comfort to passengers.

title: Russia makes first delivery of Nuclear-fuel for TN nuclear plant's 3rd unit
content: Undeterred by global pressures, Russia has commenced nuclear fuel deliveries for Kudankulam's third unit, reinforcing its commitment to uninterrupted energy cooperation with India. This marks the first VVER-1000 fuel shipment under a new contract, promising extended operational cycles and improved performance for India's growing nuclear power capacity.

title: Home loan interest rates set to fall to historic low of 7.1% after RBI move
content: Home loan rates are poised to fall to Covid-era lows following a 25 basis point repo rate cut by the RBI. This move is expected to lower EMIs for borrowers, though banks may need to adjust deposit rates. Non-banking finance companies anticipate immediate benefits from reduced funding costs, aiding last-mile financiers and small businesses.

title: India, Russia agree to boost efforts on joint climate action
content: India and Russia have pledged to boost joint efforts on climate action, aligning with global UN goals and the Paris Agreement. Both nations will collaborate on increasing climate finance and technology access for developing countries. They also agreed to intensify dialogue on carbon trading, low-carbon technologies, and sustainable finance, while continuing cooperation within G20, Brics, and SCO.

title: Pakistan: Why even a locked up Imran Khan may still be a threat for Asim Munir - explained
content: Imprisoned Imran Khan remains a potent threat to Pakistan's de facto ruler, army chief Asim Munir. Despite confinement, Khan's victimhood narrative and enduring popularity fuel sentiment against Munir's state control. The rivalry highlights the challenge of managing public perception versus institutional power.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly slashing its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its ambitious virtual reality vision after incurring over $70 billion in losses. This move comes as the company doubles down on artificial intelligence, investing heavily in AI infrastructure and talent acquisition.

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan dinner: Putin echoes ‘sabka saath, sabka vikas’ message - video
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin invoked India's 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas' slogan, stating it reflects the true character of India-Russia relations. He emphasized cooperation in the Eurasian space to build peace, trust, and security for all, highlighting the strategic and people-centric nature of their partnership.

title: After 10-yr chase, wildlife sleuths nab the ‘ghost’
content: Interpol-wanted wildlife trafficker Yangchen Lachungpa, a decade-long fugitive, was apprehended in a remote Sikkim village. Her arrest, following a complex operation, marks a significant breakthrough in combating international wildlife smuggling. Authorities believe her network linked Indian tiger reserves to Nepal, Tibet, and China, dealing in various endangered species parts.

title: After Kudankulam project, Modi & Putin discuss building 2nd Russian N-plant in India
content: India and Russia are set to significantly boost nuclear energy collaboration following President Putin's visit. Discussions focused on constructing a second Russian-designed nuclear power plant, with India committed to finalizing site allocation. The agreement also encompasses expanding cooperation in fuel cycle, lifecycle support for Kudankulam, and peaceful atomic energy applications.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says he's spending his weekends studying…
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is studying startup product development, admitting the tech giant's size is a major AI disadvantage.  He's restructuring to flatten hierarchies and foster faster innovation, emphasizing a 'learn-it-all' mindset over past successes.  Nadella warns AI projects fail without fundamental workflow redesign and data integration, highlighting the urgent need for reinvention.

title: Cheetah project hit: 10-month-old cub found dead; Veera, sibling under watch
content: Tragedy struck India's cheetah reintroduction project as a 10-month-old cub died in Kuno National Park just a day after its 'historic' release. The cub, separated from its mother Veera and sibling, was found dead Friday. Officials are awaiting an autopsy to determine the cause, while the mother and remaining cub are reportedly safe and monitored closely.

title: SIA conducts raids in Kashmir in white collar terror network probe
content: Jammu and Kashmir's State Investigation Agency conducted raids in Srinagar and Ganderbal, targeting a white-collar terror network. Investigations into an inter-state module led to the search of an AC technician's residence and another individual's home, uncovering links to weapons and a Jaish-e-Mohammad module involving doctors.

title: Tezpur university crisis deepens as prof takes charge as acting VC suo motu
content: Tezpur University faces turmoil as senior professor Dhruba Bhattacharyya takes charge as acting vice-chancellor, citing university statutes. This move follows a controversial board meeting where a pro-VC was reportedly appointed, sparking student and faculty protests against the absent VC, Shambhu Nath Singh, over alleged corruption and mismanagement. Bhattacharyya aims to resume academic activities and exams.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife’s donations: Scott cuts Amazon stake; gives millions to DEI causes
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Trey Benson Week 14 update: Gannon addresses Cardinals RB’s knee injury
content: Arizona Cardinals face backfield woes as running back Trey Benson remains sidelined with a knee injury, casting doubt on his return this season. His absence forces the team to rely on Bam Knight, Emari Demercado, and Michael Carter, impacting offensive rhythm during a critical period.  The situation highlights the need for depth and strategic adjustments.

title: Omarion Hampton status update: Chargers RB outlook for Week 14 revealed
content: Los Angeles Chargers running back Omarion Hampton is progressing well from an ankle injury that sidelined him since Week 5. He has participated in limited practices, wearing a non-contact jersey, and is "on track and looking good" according to coach Jim Harbaugh. A final decision on his Week 14 availability against the Eagles is expected later this week.

title: Candace Owens slammed for ‘running scared’ from Charlie Kirk livestream
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Travis Kelce’s candid comments on Taylor Swift spark fresh future speculation
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Sabalenka & Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements and ventures
content: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding açaí company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: Rare! SMAT: Arjun Tendulkar does what father Sachin failed to do in his playing days
content: Arjun Tendulkar has achieved a unique T20 milestone by opening both batting and bowling for Goa, a feat his father Sachin Tendulkar never accomplished. Arjun's all-round performance in his new role highlights his growing impact in domestic cricket, contrasting with his father's T20 career, where he primarily opened the batting.

title: Why deal maker Trump is unable to foster a deal between Russia & Ukraine?
content: Despite diplomatic efforts, the Ukraine war remains stalled as Russia insists on territorial gains and a weakened Ukraine. A US peace plan, initially seen as pro-Russian, has been revised, but Moscow's maximalist demands and Kyiv's insistence on sovereignty create a significant gap.

title: How long does it take our eyes to adapt to darkness and why does it happen
content: Eyes need time to adjust to darkness, with pupils widening in seconds and cones adapting in minutes. Full night vision, reliant on rods and rhodopsin regeneration, takes 30 to 45 minutes. Understanding this process explains challenges in dim light and the importance of limiting bright light exposure for better adaptation.

title: Kyler Murray injury update: Cardinals coach Jonathan Gannon confirms star QB done for 2025 season, future in doubt
content: Arizona Cardinals' 2025 season faces a significant setback as star quarterback Kyler Murray is officially out for the year due to a persistent foot injury.  This development forces the team to re-evaluate their quarterback future, including contract implications and potential trade scenarios, as they navigate the remainder of the season and plan for 2026.

title: President Murmu hosts grand feast for Putin - what was on the menu
content: President Droupadi Murmu hosted Russian President Vladimir Putin for a grand state banquet at Rashtrapati Bhavan, concluding his two-day visit. The event featured a curated menu of Indian delicacies and a musical celebration blending Indian classical and Russian melodies, reinforcing diplomatic and cultural ties.

title: Shocking! IPL: Not RCB, CSK or MI… this team becomes world’s most-searched on Google
content: Punjab Kings achieved significant global recognition, ranking fourth in Google's Top Five Most Searched Sports Teams worldwide for 2025. This achievement highlights the franchise's strong digital presence and growing international fan base, making them the highest-ranked IPL team on the list. The ranking reflects fans' deep engagement with the team's players, performances, and brand identity.

title: 'Everyone has their own conscience': Cong vs Tharoor flares up again over Putin dinner invite
content: Congress leaders criticized MP Shashi Tharoor for accepting an invitation to a Presidential dinner for Vladimir Putin, while Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge were excluded. Leaders questioned the government's intentions and Tharoor's decision, highlighting a perceived snub to the opposition and a departure from democratic traditions.

title: Alarm bells before ODI decider? India coach warns South Africa: 'We’re desperate'
content: India faces a 'desperate' situation in the series decider against South Africa, admits assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate. Following a Test series loss and a 1-1 ODI scoreline, the team understands the pressure. Dew is a major factor, forcing adaptation in batting and bowling strategies. India aims to maximize scores despite challenging conditions.

title: From Kashmiri saffron to Assam tea: What all PM Modi gifted Putin - see pics
content: Prime Minister Modi presented President Putin with culturally significant gifts, including Assam Black Tea, an ornate silver tea set, a silver horse, a marble chess set, Kashmiri saffron, and a Russian translation of the Srimad Bhagavad Gita. These gifts underscore the enduring friendship and shared cultural values between India and Russia, complementing discussions on deepening bilateral relations and strategic partnerships.

title: 'Hidma was trapped': Maoists say contractors acted as informers; committee rejects encounter claim
content: Maoists claim top leader Madvi Hidma was trapped and killed by police informers, including contractors, after seeking medical treatment. The outfit alleges a staged encounter and demands a judicial inquiry into Hidma's and Shankar's deaths, dismissing claims by former MLA Manish Kunjam and activist Soni Sori as baseless. They assert a coordinated joint operation.

title: IndiGo fiasco: Railways comes to the rescue; adds 116 coaches amid passenger rush
content: Indian Railways has deployed 116 extra coaches across 37 trains to ease passenger travel disruptions caused by the IndiGo flight crisis. Northern Railways is also running five special trains to manage the increased demand. This initiative aims to accommodate the unexpected surge in travelers seeking alternative routes, with various coach types added based on route needs.

title: 'Told to move car': UP woman dies after drunk duo plough into family; 2 others critical
content: A dispute over parking and drinking escalated violently in Bijnor when two men allegedly rammed their car into a family. The incident, which occurred after the family asked the men to leave, resulted in the death of one woman and serious injuries to two others. The accused have been arrested.

title: ‘Not a simple divorce’: Woman accused of killing mother-in-law seeks Rs 45L alimony; HC halts payout
content: Gujarat High Court has temporarily halted a family court's order for Dipak Agrawal to pay Rs 45 lakh in alimony to his estranged wife, Nikita Agrawal. Nikita is accused of murdering her mother-in-law, and Dipak argued against paying maintenance to someone facing such a grave charge. The court cited the serious nature of the allegations in its decision.

title: Who is Saquon Barkley’s college sweetheart turned fiancée Anna Congdon?
content: Saquon Barkley’s fiancée Anna Congdon has been with him since their Penn State days, raising their two kids, Jada and Saquon Barkley Jr, through draft night, Giants seasons, the move to the Philadelphia Eagles and a Super Bowl win. Inside their family life, from viral sideline moments to the support system Barkley credits for keeping his career grounded.

title: Heavy fine! Pakistan's Zaman faces ICC punishment: What did he do wrong?
content: Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman has been fined 10 per cent of his match fee and received one demerit point for a Level 1 ICC Code of Conduct breach. The violation occurred during the Tri-Series final against Sri Lanka when Zaman showed dissent towards an umpire's dismissal decision. He admitted the offence and accepted the proposed sanction.

title: UPSSSC PET result 2025 released declared: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The UPSSSC has declared the PET Result 2025, a decisive benchmark that determines eligibility for Group “B” and “C” posts across Uttar Pradesh. Held on September 6 and 7, the exam now paves the way for upcoming recruitment stages. Candidates can download their scorecards from upsssc.gov.in and must verify all details before preparing for mains and post-specific selections.

title: How orbital satellite mega constellations could change astronomy forever
content: Satellite megaconstellations are increasingly impacting astronomical observations. Bright satellite streaks are compromising ground and space-based telescope images, while radio telescopes struggle with growing orbital radio noise. This crowded orbit challenges future missions and affects long-term research by increasing light scatter and debris, necessitating new strategies to preserve sky clarity for scientific discovery.

title: Pak military revamp: Asim Munir appointed first CDF; 5-year tenure begins
content: Pakistan has officially appointed Field Marshal Asim Munir as the country's first Chief of Defence Forces (CDF), a significant military restructuring. This new role consolidates operational and strategic authority under a single command, aiming for faster decision-making. Munir will concurrently serve as Chief of Army Staff for a five-year term.

title: ‘No means no’: Tharoor introduces bill to criminalise marital rape, says ‘only yes means yes’
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has introduced a bill in the Lok Sabha to criminalise marital rape. The proposed law aims to remove the current exception that allows non-consensual sex within marriage. Tharoor stressed the urgent need to uphold women's rights and constitutional values. The bill seeks to amend the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Rs 70k to B'luru but Rs 25k to London: Fares reach sky high amid IndiGo crisis; flyers rush for options
content: IndiGo's massive operational chaos led to hundreds of flight cancellations and exorbitant domestic fares, with Delhi-Bengaluru tickets reaching Rs 70,000. International destinations like Thailand and London offered significantly cheaper alternatives. The airline's miscalculation of pilot needs under new regulations caused widespread traveler distress and criticism over its management.

title: IndiGo crisis: Bengaluru couple attends own wedding reception virtually
content: A newlywed couple, stranded in Bhubaneswar due to IndiGo flight cancellations, virtually attended their own wedding reception in Hubballi.  Their parents represented them at the venue, with the couple appearing on a large screen via video call.  This incident highlights the widespread travel chaos caused by airline operational issues, prompting calls for government intervention.

title: Investing FOMO: How do you stop it from running your money life? Explained
content: When markets boom, wedding conversations shift to stock tips, fueling FOMO. Investors often chase recent gains, entering late and exiting during downturns, leading to lower actual returns. A disciplined approach, focusing on long-term goals and a small 'mad money' allocation for experiments, is key to navigating market hype.

title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros: Why it is a BIG deal
content: Two and a half decades later, that humble mail-order start-up is preparing to buy the studio that helped build modern Hollywood itself. Netflix’s planned acquisition of Warner Bros – the century-old home of Casablanca, Harry Potter, DC superheroes, The Lord of the Rings (via New Line), HBO and control of classics like The Wizard of Oz – for an enterprise value of roughly 82.7 billion dollars marks a transformative moment in entertainment history. For the first time, a company that began its life shipping DVDs is about to take ownership of a film and television library that has shaped global culture for a hundred years.

title: Gautam Gambhir under fire! 'Stop confusing him': Ex-India star blasts team management
content: Ravichandran Ashwin urged head coach Gautam Gambhir to provide Washington Sundar with clear role clarity as a primary bowler who can bat. Ashwin highlighted India's finishing struggles and questioned if a fast-bowling all-rounder like Nitish Kumar Reddy might be a better option given the team's bowling limitations.

title: America alone: New US strategy dumps on the world
content: the new US 2025 national security strategy wants to enlist new Delhi to prevent domination by 'any single competitor nation' it rejects the bipartisan internationalist framework that has guided Washington since the end of the Cold War . in doing so, it fundamentally redefines America’s posture toward Asia, India, and the Indo-Pacific .

title: Detained AAP MLA’s plea listed for final hearing on Dec 18
content:
AAP MLA Mehraj Malik

JAMMU: Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court has listed a habeas corpus petition filed by detained AAP MLA Mehraj Malik for final consideration on Dec 18. Malik, who is AAP’s J&K unit president, was detained under the stringent Public Safety Act (PSA) on Sept 8 for allegedly disturbing public order and was lodged in Kathua jail. On Sept 24, Malik filed a habeas corpus petition, challenging his detention and claiming Rs 5 crore as compensation. During the last hearing on Nov 20, the HC had said it would hear the plea on Dec 4, which has now been deferred to Dec 18.

End of Article
